column4: what can I do if xorg locks up on starting up and an xfix doesn't solve it?
Boot into recovery mode, go to root shell and edit your xorg.conf to use the "vesa" driver to get a basic driver going
What exactly does it prompt for ( and if you misspell my name I won't notice your replies, try typing the first few letters then hitting tab )
I have to paraphrase since I'm running off the recovery CD right now.  When I select NETBOOT it prompts for the administrator password in a black text-mode console
I typed up a new xorg.conf but I don't have much faith in it; I've had bad luck getting my widescreen LCD to work w/o an accelerated driver in the past.
Why are you choosing "NETBOOT" and what recovery CD? You should be using the "recovery mode" option from the grub menu
I'm currently in the 9.04 recovery CD.  When doing netboot I was using the recovery mode grub option on my normal installation.
The recovery mode option shouldn't say anything about netboot IIRC
Basically anything off the recovery mode option that tried to go to a shell would ask for my root password.
That's odd, is this a fairly standard install?
might be netroot--it's the one that would take somebody into what would normally be init 3 on another OS.

I upgraded from 8.10 to 9.04.  It was being a good boy until I tried to install the ATI 9.3 drivers when I should have done 9.4.  Now it locks up going into X and it snubs me trying to do any console recover stuff.
Ok, what is this recovery CD you were talking about?
A 9.04 LiveCD
Do you know what a chroot is?
chroot doesn't seem to work.  I think the LiveCD is 32-bit but my OS is 64-bit.  So I get into trouble when it tries to run bash.
About the only thing I can think of is trying this hacked up xorg.conf.  Problem is that it takes me about 10 minutes to boot back in to here with IRC if it doesn't work.
Ok, can you just edit your xorg.conf and add: Driver "vesa"       To your device section?
pastebin the xorg.conf

Ah well I'm going to try booting into that xorg.conf.  I won't see anything for 10 minutes or so if I have to boot back off the liveCD.
